intro: Osmorhiza aristata var. montana, commonly known as mountain sweetroot, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and meadows. Its roots are fibrous and have been used traditionally for medicinal purposes. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
